metadata.title: CVE-2022-31625 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In PHP versions 7.4.x below 7.4.30, 8.0.x below 8.0.20, and 8.1.x below8.1.7, when using Postgres database extension, supplying invalid parametersto the parametrized query may lead to PHP attempting to free memory usinguninitialized data as pointers. This could lead to RCE vulnerability ordenial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31625` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.1
libapache2-mod-php8.0 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.1
libapache2-mod-php8.1 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.1
libphp8.1-embed - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.1
php8.1 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.1
php8.1-bcmath - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.1

criterions.comment: php8.1 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1.2-1ubuntu2.1').
